body:
Hi Farzaneh,


You need to be a little more specific with your question.


If you use the "-c xyz" option to raw2hdr, and output to a ".hdr" file, it will write out XYZE pixel values.  I have not found this to be terribly accurate, however.


Also, this will not "discount the illuminant" if you have your camera's white balance fixed to daylight, as you should.


-Greg
___
<sup>Automatically generated content from [radiance mailing-list](https://radiance-online.org/pipermail/hdri/2017-February/000619.html).</sup>
